content: The energetic Cam Skattebo has added a new element to the Giants, who face the Eagles on Thursday night.

title: Annual NBA survey: OKC repeats, Jokic as MVP
content: The NBA's annual offseason survey envisions the Thunder repeating as league champions, with Nuggets superstar Nikola Jokic predicted to win his fourth Most Valuable Player honor, according to the poll conducted of all 30 teams' front offices.

content: USA Basketball is expected to hire the Miami Heat's Erik Spoelstra as the next head coach of the men's national team, sources told ESPN.

title: Rahm scuffles at Spanish Open, barks at marshal
content: Jon Rahm and Shane Lowry struggled in their return to action after helping Europe win the Ryder Cup, with Rahm briefly arguing with a marshal who tried to cheer him up during the Spanish Open.

content: The Yankees believed this team was more talented and more complete than the club that went to the World Series a year ago, but they saw their season end Wednesday night in the ALDS.

title: Jaguars get Newsome, Campbell goes to Browns
content: The Jaguars and Browns agreed to a trade of cornerbacks Wednesday night, with Greg Newsome heading to Jacksonville and Tyson Campbell going to Cleveland.

title: 'Fail Mary' backlash still hurts Bears' Stevenson
content: Bears cornerback Tyrique Stevenson says the backlash he received for his role in tipping a Hail Mary pass against the Commanders last season "still hurts."

content: A'ja Wilson made a turnaround jumper with 0.3 seconds left, capping a stellar 34-point night and lifting the Aces over the Mercury 90-88 on Wednesday for a 3-0 lead in the WNBA Finals.

title: 'Spoke to my friend': PM Modi congratulates Trump on 'historic' Gaza plan; discuss trade deal
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated US President Donald Trump on the success of the historic Gaza peace plan during a phone call. The leaders also reviewed the progress in trade negotiations and agreed to maintain close contact in the coming weeks.

title: 'Ended war': Trump gives timeline on hostage release; Gaza plan to be signed in Egypt
content: US President Donald Trump announced the end of the Gaza war and a ceasefire deal, expecting hostages to be released Monday or Tuesday. He plans a trip to Egypt for an official signing of the agreement. However, Hamas rejected Trump's proposed "Board of Peace" to oversee Gaza's administration.

title: Will Donald come up trumps with a Nobel Peace Prize?
content: US President Donald Trump's open lobbying for the Nobel Peace Prize has become a subject of widespread mockery, with late-night hosts parodying his desperate quest. Despite claims of ending conflicts, critics point to his role in escalating others.

title: Bihar polls: NDA seat-sharing talks - is BJP in a bind after 2024 majority miss?
content: Indian elections on June 4, 2024, brought back coalition politics. The BJP did not secure a majority. This has made seat-sharing talks in Bihar challenging. Allies like Nitish Kumar's JD(U) now hold significant power. Smaller allies are testing the alliance's strength. The BJP must balance keeping allies happy with its own interests.

title: Google changes work policy: ‚ÄòWork From Anywhere‚Äô can‚Äôt be used for WFH; sends memo
content: Google is reportedly tightening its "Work from Anywhere" policy, now counting any day worked remotely outside the office as a full week. This change, intended to prevent WFA from substituting regular hybrid work, has drawn criticism from employees for its confusing implementation and restrictions.

title: 'He deserves it!': Bibi says Trump should get Nobel; big decision on Oct 10
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu endorsed US President Donald Trump for the Nobel Peace Prize, citing his role in forging peace agreements. Netanyahu's office shared an AI image of Trump with the medal, following a recent ceasefire and hostage release arrangement between Israel and Hamas.

title: Education of Nobel Peace Prize-winning US presidents
content: US President Donald Trump has been nominated for the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize amid international endorsements. This article explores the educational backgrounds of the four American presidents who previously won the Nobel Peace Prize: Theodore Roosevelt, Woodrow Wilson, Jimmy Carter, and Barack Obama. It details their academic achievements, presidential tenures, reasons for receiving the prize, and current status, highlighting their diverse educational journeys from Harvard and Princeton to the US Naval Academy and beyond.

title: Why Nobel Literature winner Krazsnahorkai is Kafka's literary heir of despair
content: Critics have called him ‚Äúthe Kafka of our time.‚Äù The New York Times described him as ‚Äúa writer of haunting, Kafkaesque intensity.‚Äù The Guardian dubbed him ‚Äúthe Hungarian master of apocalypse.‚Äù Translator George Szirtes said his novels ‚Äúcome from the same Central European forest as Kafka‚Äôs.‚Äù

title: China to India: 'Promise' that rare earth magnets supplied will not be re-exported to US
content: China has tightened rare earth export controls, restricting processing technology and targeting defense and semiconductor users. Beijing is reportedly seeking guarantees from India that its heavy rare earth magnets will not be re-exported to the US, aiming to use these controls as a bargaining chip in trade talks.

title: Deepika Padukone finally breaks her silence on exit from Spirit and Kalki 2898 AD sequel
content: Amid ongoing talks over her exit from Sandeep Vanga Reddy‚Äôs Spirit and the Kalki 2898 AD sequel, Deepika Padukone has broken her silence, addressing the gender double standards in the industry without naming anyone. In a recent interview, Deepika responded to reports that she had demanded fixed 8-hour working shifts.

title: Inside Coldrif plant: Rusty equipment among 364 violations found; deadly lapses exposed
content: Madhya Pradesh police arrested Sresan Pharmaceuticals owner G Ranganathan, 73, in Chennai after his cough syrup, Coldrif, was linked to 21 child deaths due to toxic chemicals. The company, despite operating with numerous violations for years, is now under national scrutiny, with its manufacturing unit sealed.

title: Zoho's Sridhar Vembu sends ‚ÄòThank You‚Äô message to Amit Shah; dedicates it to engineers
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has switched to Zoho Mail, India's homegrown email platform, a move celebrated by Zoho co-founder Sridhar Vembu. This decision aligns with the government's push for digital sovereignty and boosts the adoption of Indian tech solutions. Shah's endorsement signifies a growing confidence in the nation's indigenous digital infrastructure.

title: Prithvi Shaw-Musheer row: Heated clash fizzles out! 'I'm like an elder brother'
content: Prithvi Shaw has apologized to former teammate Musheer Khan after an on-field altercation during a friendly match. The incident occurred after Shaw's century against his old side, Mumbai. The two were later seen having a friendly chat, with Shaw reportedly telling Musheer he's like an elder brother to him. Meanwhile, Sarfaraz Khan is fit for the Ranji Trophy after injury rehab.

title: Bihar elections 2025: It's AK vs PK - AAP's surprise big bet explained
content: Arvind Kejriwal's Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) will contest all 243 seats in Bihar, aiming to offer its governance model as an alternative to existing alliances. This move introduces a new dynamic alongside Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj, both vying for space created by voter fatigue with traditional politics.

title: Nobel Peace Prize: Trump eyes honour; why Norway is on edge
content: The Norwegian Nobel Committee has finalized its 2025 Peace Prize decision, with any potential Israel-Gaza peace deal to be considered for next year. Norway faces pressure from Donald Trump's aggressive lobbying for the award, creating diplomatic and economic concerns for the Scandinavian nation.

title: ‚ÄòExtremely exaggerated‚Äô: TCS dismisses rumours of over 50,000 layoffs; says 1% released
content: Tata Consultancy Services has confirmed laying off approximately 6,000 employees, about 1% of its workforce. Severance packages are being offered based on service length and skill obsolescence, reflecting an organizational shift towards integrating new technologies.

title: Controversial! Sahibzada Farhan defies ICC warning; repeats gun-firing celebration
content: Pakistan batter Sahibzada Farhan has reignited controversy by repeating his gun-firing celebration during a promotional shoot, despite an ICC warning. This act follows a similar on-field incident during the Asia Cup against India, where he and Haris Rauf faced sanctions. Farhan maintains his celebrations are spontaneous and part of an aggressive approach.

title: Hand of 'Gaud'! Indian seamer grabs a stunner in her follow-through ‚Äì watch
content: Kranti Gaud's brilliant reflex catch gave India a crucial early breakthrough against South Africa.  This emerging star, who debuted just months ago, has become India's key new-ball bowler.  Her rise from net bowler to national hero, marked by impressive performances, continues to inspire.

title: Turki Al-Sheikh net worth: Can Saudi billionaire afford a Manchester United takeover?
content: Saudi entertainment and sports magnate Turki Al-Sheikh, chairman of the General Entertainment Authority, is a visionary billionaire driving the Kingdom's global sports revolution. He has spearheaded major investments in football, boxing, WWE, and UFC, significantly shaping Saudi Arabia's international influence and soft power projection through sports diplomacy.

title: Trade war heats up: US targets Chinese tech firms; Beijing vows ‚Äònecessary measures‚Äô
content: The Trump administration has expanded export restrictions to include subsidiaries of Chinese tech companies on the entity list, aiming to close loopholes. This move targets firms like Huawei and DJI, impacting tens of thousands of entities and drawing sharp condemnation from Beijing as US-China tech tensions escalate.

title: Nobel claim: Sorry Trump, even AI isn't buying it
content: AI chatbots, including ChatGPT, Gemini, and Grok, have largely dismissed Donald Trump's claim of deserving a Nobel Peace Prize for ending seven wars. Experts and the AI models found his assertions disputed, vague, or exaggerated, highlighting a lack of solid evidence for truly ending conflicts. While acknowledging some de-escalatory efforts, they deem them insufficient for the prestigious award.

title: Diwali 2025 in USA: Date, time, and muhurat across ET, PT, CT, and other zones
content: Diwali, the festival of lights, arrives soon for the Hindu community in the United States. Celebrations will take place on Monday, October 20. Specific auspicious timings for Lakshmi Puja vary across different time zones. Residents on the Pacific Coast, Eastern, Central, and Mountain time zones can find their precise puja muhurat. This ensures blessings for prosperity and happiness. Read below!

title: Investing in PPF? Don‚Äôt exceed Rs 1.5L limit; interest on excess will be taken back!
content: New rules now link PPF investments to PAN, making it impossible to hide multiple accounts. Exceeding the Rs 1.5 lakh annual limit can lead to interest clawback on excess contributions.  Irregular accounts won't earn interest, with minor accounts earning a mere 4% until regularized.

title: Nobel Prize in Literature: Hungarian author wins for 'visionary' work amid 'apocalyptic terror'
content: L√°szl√≥ Krasznahorkai has been awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature 2025 for his compelling and visionary oeuvre. The Swedish Academy announced the prestigious award on Thursday. This year's literature prize joins announcements for Chemistry, Physics, and Medicine, recognizing significant scientific and artistic achievements.

title: Prithvi Shaw: From child prodigy to career marred by controversies - Full timeline
content: Prithvi Shaw scored 181 in a practice match. The innings saw a heated argument with a teammate. This incident adds to Shaw's past controversies. Fitness concerns have also affected his career. He was not picked in the IPL 2025 auction. Shaw has moved to Maharashtra for a fresh start.

title: What fear does to your brain and body
content: When startled, your brain and body activate the fight-or-flight response, flooding you with stress hormones. This rapid reaction, coordinated by the amygdala and hypothalamus, quickens breathing, raises heart rate, and sharpens senses for survival. While essential, chronic activation can harm health, but managing fear through mindfulness, exercise, and support is possible.

title: IND vs SA: Smriti Mandhana shatters record! Closes in on 5000 runs
content: Smriti Mandhana has become the highest run-getter in women's ODIs in a single calendar year, surpassing Belinda Clark's 28-year-old record. She achieved this milestone during India's World Cup clash against South Africa, amassing 982 runs in 17 matches this year. Mandhana's exceptional form continues to redefine consistency in women's ODI cricket.

title: 1st in India! K'taka approves 12 menstrual leaves a year; what policy says
content: Karnataka has become India's first state to approve menstrual leave for women, allowing up to 12 sanctioned leaves annually. State minister Santosh Lad announced the progressive law, emphasizing its welfare-oriented approach for women. The decision marks a significant step for women's rights in the state.

title: India-UK CEO Forum: PM Modi, Starmer chart 'roadmap for shared progress'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and UK PM Keir Starmer addressed the India-UK CEO Forum, highlighting the Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA) and its potential to double bilateral trade to $112 billion by 2030. The leaders emphasized CETA's role in enhancing market access, strengthening MSMEs, and fostering collaboration in commerce, education, technology, and aspirations, building on existing strong economic ties.

title: IPS officer 'suicide' case: Wife claims husband faced 'years of humiliation'; mystery note in focus
content: Wife of deceased IPS officer Y Puran Kumar, IAS officer Amneet P Kumar, has lodged a complaint seeking FIR against Haryana DGP Shatrujeet Singh Kapur and Rohtak SP Narendra Bijarnia for abetment to suicide and SC/ST Act violations. She alleges her husband faced systematic persecution and humiliation due to his caste, pushing him to suicide.

title: Crippled by Op Sindoor, JeM forms women's wing; who will lead unit?
content: Pakistan-based terror group Jaish-e-Mohammed has launched its first women's wing, 'Jamaat-ul-Mominaat,' led by Maulana Masood Azhar's sister. Recruitment targets wives of commanders and vulnerable women. This strategic shift, possibly prompted by recent attacks and Indian Army operations, signals a potential move towards training female suicide attackers, aligning JeM with other groups that have utilized women in combat roles.

title: Was Ashwin 'forced' into retirement by Rohit, Gautam Gambhir?
content: Ravichandran Ashwin clarified his retirement from cricket was a personal choice, not influenced by selectors or teammates, despite advice to reconsider. He emphasized the need for clear communication between senior players like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli and team management regarding their future roles and the 2027 World Cup.

title: Boost for Indian students: UK to open 9 university campuses in India
content: India and the United Kingdom are strengthening their educational partnership. Nine British universities will soon open campuses in India. This collaboration aims to provide high-quality higher education. It is expected to create thousands of skilled jobs. This move signifies a major expansion in bilateral education cooperation. Both nations anticipate significant growth and enhanced opportunities.

title: Korean singer Yoon Ji-ah killed by fan who once donated $70K
content: South Korean TikToker Yoon Ji-ah, with over 300,000 fans, was found dead on a mountain after her last livestream. Her death, caused by suffocation from neck compression, was inflicted by a fan who had developed an obsession and financial troubles. The incident highlights the dangers of fan communities and influencer security.

title: 'Thank You‚Äô turns ugly! Shaw faces inquiry; Vengsarkar to lead probe
content: Cricket authorities are investigating an incident where Prithvi Shaw swung his bat at Musheer Khan. The confrontation happened after Shaw's dismissal in a practice match. Both Mumbai and Maharashtra cricket associations are gathering reports. Dilip Vengsarkar will oversee the probe. Player discipline is a key focus for the associations.

title: Watch: Celebrations erupt in Khan Yunis after Trump's Gaza peace deal
content: Gaza streets erupted in celebration as President Trump announced a peace deal between Israel and Hamas, bringing an end to the war. Residents expressed immense joy and gratitude for the cessation of bloodshed. Families of hostages shared overwhelming happiness as their loved ones are set to return home.

title: 'Gauti bhai said‚Ä¶': Surya opens up on how Samson‚Äôs role changed in Asia Cup
content: Suryakumar Yadav lauded Sanju Samson's resilience amidst selection doubts, highlighting his crucial role in India's Asia Cup triumph. Samson, who embraced a changed batting position, proved his impact and was later recognized with the CEAT T20 Batter of the Year award. He expressed his dedication to the Indian team, willing to bat anywhere and contribute in any role.

title: Riyadh Air to launch its 1st London flights on Oct 26, but tickets won‚Äôt be open to public
content: Riyadh Air, Saudi Arabia‚Äôs new national carrier, begins its first international route to London Heathrow on October 26 using a leased 787-9. Initial flights are limited to staff and affiliates as part of an operational trial phase. Public ticket sales will open later, following delivery of the airline‚Äôs own aircraft and final readiness evaluations.

title: Discounts double! India to step up Russia oil imports; increase despite Trump pressure
content: Indian refiners are eyeing more Russian crude imports as price discounts widen, despite ongoing US discussions.  October arrivals are set to increase, with potential for further growth.  While the US has pressured India to curb these purchases, New Delhi maintains its price-driven strategy.

title: Gill speaks about taking over ODI captaincy from Rohit for the first time
content: Shubman Gill, set to captain India in ODIs against Australia, aims to emulate Rohit Sharma's calm leadership and team unity.  The young skipper emphasised the crucial role of veterans Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli in the upcoming series. Gill also highlighted his positive rapport with coach Gautam Gambhir, focusing on player security and fast bowler development.

content: A Nissan Patrol, a Nissan Pickup Truck, and a Toyota Prado seized in Kochi. Total number of vehicles seized under Operation Numkhor now 43

content: The kit will benefit about 4.48 crore population holding below poverty line cards and will include tur dal, oil, sugar and salt

content: Saksham boasts of features such as real-time threat detection and AI-enabled predictive analysis, integration of sensors and weapons for synchronised response, and 3D battlefield visualisation, says the Army

title: Pilot project to increase crop productivity through crop diversification begins in Nandyal
content: Project aims to improve the livelihoods of farmers through sustainable agriculture production systems, says coordinator B. Sahadeva Reddy

title: 5 Killed As House Collapses After Powerful Explosion In Ayodhya: Cops
content: At least five people were killed and several others were injured after a house collapsed following a powerful explosion at a village in Pagla Bhari village under the Pura Kalandar police station area of Ayodhya on Thursday, officials said.

title: With Jobs Promise, Tejashwi Yadav Hopes To Cash In On Bihar's Aspirations
content: At the heart of Bihar, where the Ganges weaves its stories through a tapestry of dreams and despair, a figure stands, hoping to redefine the narrative of a state marked by promise and peril.

title: "Feels Like I Don't Belong Here": Meghalaya Woman Alleges Racial Abuse In Delhi
content: It was a regular evening errand that turned into one of the most distressing nights of her life. Rittu Marak, a 27-year-old flight attendant from Meghalaya's Garo Hills, said she faced racist abuse not once but twice within an hour in Delhi.

title: Student Used AI To Create Pornographic Images Of Classmates, Arrested
content: A 20-year-old student from the International Institute of Information Technology (IIIT) in Naya Raipur was arrested Wednesday for allegedly creating obscene images of female classmates using AI tools, said the police.

title: "Friendship On The Move": PM Modi's Car Ride With Keir Starmer
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said the ties between India and the United Kingdom are "on the move" and "filled with great vigour", while sharing a picture with his British counterpart Keir Starmer during the latter's two-day visit.

title: In Sunjay Kapur Estate Battle, A "Cinderella Stepmother" Swipe At His Wife
content: The inheritance battle over Sunjay Kapur's Rs 30,000-crore estate got murkier today with the senior lawyer appearing for Karisma Kapoor's children comparing the late industrialist's widow, Priya Sachdev Kapur, to Cinderella's stepmother

title: "If Bihar Doesn't Vote For Such People...": Prashant Kishor On Candidates
content: A host of doctors, lawyers, former bureaucrats and police officers with a clean image on his first list of 51 poll candidates, election strategist-turned-politician Prashant Kishor has said if they do not get elected, the people will be responsible.

title: If Iran Got Nuclear Weapons, Peace Deal Would Not Have Been Possible: Trump
content: US President Donald Trump spoke about the strikes on Iran's nuclear facilities earlier this year, noting that Iran was close to developing nuclear weapons and if that had happened then the Gaza peace deal would not have been possible.

title: Video: Cars Stuck For Miles As China Highway Sees Massive Jam
content: China's largest toll station in Anhui Province saw a huge traffic jam as millions of travellers returned home on Monday, October 6, after concluding the 8-day National Day and Mid-Autumn Festival holiday.

title: Haryana Top Cop Named In Officer's Suicide Note May Be Sent On Leave: Sources
content: The Haryana top cop, Shatrujeet Singh Kapur, and head of Rohtak police, Narendra Bijarnia, are likely to be sent on leave, top sources have told NDTV, days after IPS officer Y Puran Kumar died by suicide.

title: PM Congratulates Trump On Gaza Peace Plan, Discusses India-US Trade
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today congratulated US President Donald Trump on the success of the Gaza peace plan that the American leader had proposed in a major step to end a war that has killed tens of thousands of people.

title: Video: Boulder Comes Crashing Down On Moving Car In Himachal
content: A massive boulder came crashing down on a moving car in Himachal Pradesh, and the terrifying scene was captured in its dashcam. The chilling scene unfolded at Nathpa Point in Kinnaur.

title: 4-Year-Old Killed As Pickup Truck Rams Into Motorcycle, 2 Injured: Cops
content: A four-year-old child was killed, while his aunt and brother sustained injuries after the motorcycle they were travelling on collided head on with a speeding pickup vehicle on the Paniyara-Partawal road here on Thursday, police said.

title: "India An Economic Superpower In The Making": UK PM Keir Starmer
content: India is an economic superpower in the making, British Prime Minister Keir Starmer said on Thursday, adding the world's largest democracy is also on track to become its third largest by 2028.

title: Garbage Truck Carries Medicines In Chennai, Civic Body Suspends Doctor
content: The Greater Chennai Corporation has cancelled the services of a contract doctor after a controversy erupted over medicines allegedly being transported in a garbage collection vehicle to a government health centre in north Chennai.

title: Prancing Horse Goes Electric? Ferrari Gives Details Of 1st EV, Shares Tumble
content: Ferrari will begin its cautious shift to electric vehicles in 2026 with its first battery-powered four-seat coupe, but shares plummeted over a long-term profit outlook that fell short.

title: Is Technology Making Kids Lonely? Princess Kate Warns Of 'Epidemic Of Disconnection'
content: Kate, Britain's Princess of Wales, warned that smartphones and other digital devices were playing a key role in an "epidemic of disconnection" that threatened the development of young children.

title: 'Prospects Remote': Experts On Trump Winning Nobel Peace Prize
content: US President Donald Trump's bid to win the Nobel Peace Prize has drawn added attention to the annual guessing game over who its next laureate will be.

title: UK Inks $468-Million Missile Deal With India During Keir Starmer's Mumbai Visit
content: Britain said it had signed a 350 million pound ($468 million) contract to supply the Indian army with UKmanufactured lightweight missiles, as part of a deepening weapons

title: Dulquer Salmaan, Film Stars' Houses Raided Again In Luxury Car Smuggling Case
content: Malayalam superstar Dulquer Salmaan's house and over a dozen locations across South India were raided by the Enforcement Directorate amid a probe into smuggling cartels illegally importing high-end luxury vehicles from Bhutan, sources said.

title: Vin√≠cius Jr. tops Team of the Week 4 in EA FC 26
content: winger Vincius Jnior has a 90 OVR card, awarded for scoring a brace . the 25-year-old is a threat to pierce any defense . he has scored 96 Pace and 92 Dribbling in the premier league .

title: MLB division series: How Cubs and Phillies can get even, plus NLDS Game 4 lineups and analysis
content: the Chicago Cubs and Philadelphia Phillies avoided getting swept out of the playoffs . the Phillies have the edge in the starting pitcher comparison, with Game 1 starter Tyler Glasnow . we've got you covered with pregame lineups and keys along with takeaways .

title: Natalia Bryant credited as creative director for Lakers' preseason hype video
content: the los Angeles lakers turned to a familiar face to be the creative director of their preseason hype video . Natalia Bryant had a star-studded cast for the "Forever Iconic: Purple and Gold Always" video with los Angeles Dodgers star Shohei Ohtani . actor and noted lakers fan Brenda Song also made an appearance .

title: Fall weddings vs. college football: When bridesmaid dresses and school colors clash
content: the three pillars of autumn in America are the colors of fall foliage, the traditional colors of college football allegiance, bridesmaids dresses, bow ties and bridal gowns . the sun will rise and set on October Saturdays, those days shall be packed with the shifting hues of the trees aroud .

title: Joel Embiid and four other big-name players to avoid in drafts
content: Joel Embiid has averaged just 50 games played over nine seasons . he's reached 60 games just four times last season . the 76ers are a dominant fantasy player when healthy . here are five big names to avoid in your drafts .

title: At 66, John Calipari is innovating off the court, too
content: a reserve walk-on named Lawson Blake tore an Achilles while working out . calipari took over in the spring of 2024 . he was struck with a thought . "what if we had just given him a million dollars and then he got injured"

title: Falcons and Bills throwbacks, Commanders' all-black top NFL Week 6 threads
content: the Atlanta Falcons are rocking their throwback uniforms against the Buffalo Bills . the iconic helmet was reintroduced in 2022 with the old school Falcons logo . in the second game of a "Monday Night Football" doubleheader, the Washington Commanders are wearing their all-black alternates against a Chicago Bears game .
